title: Subtleties
text:
A gun owner is exactly that, the owner. They no doubt thought long and hard and such an such and then the trouble of not just buying a chair but a weapon tool. Then their is all the maintenance and the constant cost of bullets as practicing is a must.
Contingency is important, you need to weigh down on the values both ways. Should it be such a value to lose guns, one must then have a truer value of having earned a gun and as such not lose it in a snatch later in the day.
There are many trophies, many hard earned dollars which can never be unspent nor would be for practically all.
I know what my value to weapons is and almost all of my licenses are being used by other people. I am the only person I know in this country I live in South Africa, that has qualified for a Automatic Carbine license and the little shit of a politician thinks its a good Idea to forge the Politicians signature and hand them around like candy, fake copies. What is the worth of a lifetime, if it is never seen as lived?? For many an army Veteran State side I'm sure this value sits strongly.
And as I've been told, its something of a mercy to be able to shoot someone dead vs. the multitude of slow painful options left to the creative yet sinister mind of a murderer. For that is what we all are that minute.
Please consider that yes you need to do a model and that I think that My current country needs to learn not to try and copy England considering what our neighbors get up to. To think that not having a gun is safer when most walk around with my license it seems.
Think of a Heavy Promotion for people who do keep their guns, for they know they are more likely to get shot than lose their license. I feel this way.
